body:
I just looked for the other `package.json` files.

```
./validator/nodejs/package.json
./validator/package.json
./validator/gulpjs/package.json
./validator/webui/package.json
./extensions/amp-viewer-integration/0.1/messaging/package.json
./package.json
./build-system/tasks/package.json
```
- The one in `extensions/amp-viewer-integration/0.1/messaging` is something we publish, and has no dependencies to maintain.
- The one in `build-system/tasks` is unused and can be deleted.
- This leaves us with the four in `validator/`, which are owned by the Validator team. IIUC, the code in `validator/` is developed internal to Google, and periodically merged to Github, so I'm not sure how the dependency versions are updated, or if it's required that the versions be updated manually. Adding @Gregable and @powdercloud to see if dependency maintenance is something they're interested in.
